title: Mud Jeans Wants to Help Other Brands Get a Handle on EPR - Sourcing Journal
summary: Mud Jeans, a Dutch denim brand, is hosting an event to share its expertise on Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) strategies. They have been prioritizing circularity for years, collecting old jeans and recycling them into new products. Mud offers free repairs for customers participating in its 'Lease a Jeans' program, aiming to shift consumer mindset towards experiences rather than ownership.

title: How retailers are changing their approach to online returns - Econsultancy
summary: Retailers are grappling with soaring return rates, driven by factors like inflation and impulse buying.  The high cost of returns, both financially and environmentally, is pushing retailers to explore innovative solutions, such as peer-to-peer returns, promoting exchanges, and educating customers on the impact of returns.  Some brands are also optimizing reverse logistics by offering curbside returns, box-free returns, and digital click-and-collect capabilities, making the process more convenient for customers.

title: FWA CPE maximizes return on 5G spectrum ... - eeNews Europe
summary: VANTIVA, formerly Technicolor, has launched its Falcon 5G fixed wireless access (FWA) customer premises equipment (CPE) at Mobile World Congress 2023. This new device delivers fast wireless speeds over a wide area and is designed to be compact and eco-friendly, with reduced power consumption and a smaller form factor. VANTIVA highlights the sustainability features of the Falcon 5G, including its use of recycled materials, plastic-free packaging, and maximized passive convection for cooling.
